DataElement.preferredName: Enneking Musculoskeletal Tumor Society Staging System Tumor Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term and code that represents the tumor site of the musculoskeletal sarcoma, using the Enneking staging system approved by the Musculoskeletal Tumor Society (MSTS).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Enneking Staging System Local Extent Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A staging system for malignant mesenchymal tumors that takes into account the surgical grade, local extent, and presence or absence of metastasis._Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A staging system for malignant mesenchymal tumors that takes into account the surgical grade, local extent, and presence or absence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: A staging system for malignant mesenchymal tumors that takes into account the surgical grade, local extent, and presence or absence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: Enneking SSS/MSTS: Enneking Surgical Staging System adopted by the Musculoskeletal Tumor Society, Enneking WF, Spanier SS, Goodman MA. A system for the surgical staging of musculoskeletal sarcoma. 1980
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for pediatric form request 8/21/17. mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A staging system for malignant mesenchymal tumors that takes into account the surgical grade, local extent, and presence or absence of metastasis._A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality._The extent of a cancer in the body. ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bone tumors extend beyond the bone cortex.

Concepts.definition: Bone tumors extend beyond the bone cortex.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bone tumors are confined within the cortex of the bone.

Concepts.definition: Bone tumors are confined within the cortex of the bone.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
